name: Path T Oropharynx
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1, T2 or T3. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1, T2 or T3 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 2:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2 or T3) based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites: 
     Anterior wall including vallecula 
         One lateral wall (including tonsillar pillar/fossa, palatine tonsil and tonsil, NOS)
         Posterior wall 
     Base of tongue (including lingual tonsil)
     Buccal mucosa
     Floor of mouth
     Gum (gingiva)
     Involvement of both lateral walls through soft palate or base of tongue
     Soft palate
        Inferior surface including uvula 
        NOS
        Superior (nasopharyngeal) surface

    Confined to oropharynx, NOS   
    Localized, NOS

**Note 3:**  Mucosal extension to lingual surface of epiglottis from primary tumors of the base of the tongue and vallecular does not constitute invasion of the larynx.
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
